alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Latimer; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 04 at 3:27PM CDT until November 04 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Haskell, Latimer and Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 324 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Radar estimates of a half inch up to 1 inch of rain has fallen across a portion of the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcalester... Wilburton... Hartshorne... Krebs... Quinton... Kiowa... Crowder... Alderson... Kinta... Higgins... Blocker... Robbers Cave State Park... Damon... Arrowhead State Park... Mcalester Regional Airport... Blanco... Enterprise... Haileyville... Pittsburg... Gowen... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
